Profile: Aparupa Pani. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Aparupa Pani has completed her B. Tech. (Civil Engineering) from KIIT University Bhubaneswar. Later she has completed her M. Tech (Geotechnical Engineering) and PhD (Geotechnical Engineering) from National Institute of Technology (NIT), Rourkela with a full-time fellowship from the Ministry of Human Resource Development (MHRD), Government of India in the year 2014 and 2019 respectively. She has presented her research work in many national and international forums and published articles in reputed journals. Presently she is working as an Associate Professor in the School of Civil Engineering, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar. Besides, she is a reviewer in many national/international journals and also she has published many research articles in international high impact factor journals (SCI/Scopus), national/international conferences, book chapters. Along with this she is also involved with many industries to establish academia-industry collaborative research. Recently she got a prestigious Government Sponsored project under SERB_CRG scheme as a principal investigator. Her research interests are Geotechnical Engineering, Geo-environmental Engineering, Solid Waste Management, Soil Stabilization, Ground Improvement, Phytoremediation. She is passionate for learning new things and believes in collaborative research which leads to a creative innovation. Details: Email: aparupa.panifce@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57204563780, Google Scholar: https://civil.kiit.ac.in//scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=CZCOfXMAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.DM.TechB.Tech. Research Interests: Sustainable Techniques for Industrial Waste Management, Ground Improvement, Soil Stabilization, Geotechnical and Geo-environmental Issues, Synthesis and Application Geopolymers in Soil Stabilization, Microstructural Study. Administrative Responsibility: Student Career Counselling

Profile: Bandita Paikaray. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Bandita Paikaray is an Associate Professor in School of Civil Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. She joined KIIT-DU in 2008 and has been involved in various teaching and research activities. She completed her M.Tech in Geotechnical Engineering from National Institute of Technology Rourkela, Odisha in 2004 and started her teaching carrier in BIET, Bhadrak under BPUT in 2004 and continued till 2008. She completed her PhD in 2019 from Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology(KIIT), Bhubaneshwar, Odisha under the supervision of Prof. (Dr.) S.K. Das (IIT,ISM, Dhanbad)and Prof. (Dr.) Benu Gopal Mohapatra(Director ,Consultancy, KIITDU). She successfully guided her PhD scholar Ms. Manal Alali to get her degree in 2023. She also guided many M.Tech scholars during her teaching profession. She is currently working on Bearing capacity of shallow foundation, reinforced earth structure and ground improvement techniques. Details: Email: bandita.paikarayfce@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57205481565, Website: https:\/\/civil.kiit.ac.in/profiles/bandita-paikaray. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: PhD from	KIIT BhubaneswarM.Tech from NIT RourkelaB.Tech  fromCET, OUAT(Govt.) Bhubaneswar. Research Interests: Bearing capacity of shallow foundationGround improvement techniquesGeosynthetic reinforced structure.. Administrative Responsibility: FIC-Geotechnical  Engineering Research Lab

Profile: Benu Gopal Mohapatra. Role: Professor/ Director Consultancy Services. Bio: Dr. Benu Gopal Mohapatro is currently working as a Professor & Dean in School of Civil Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar since July 2010. He is actively involved in developing various industry oriented elective subjects at Under graduate and post graduate level. Also he was instrumental to launch a post graduate diploma program in Construction Management & Infrastructure Diploma program in School of Civil Engineering in 2017 in association with Simplex Infrastructures Ltd. He has obtained a PhD in Geotechnical Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Bombay in the year 2001. After PhD, he has around 10 years of professional experience in leading Geotechnical Design & Consultancy firms such as Atkins Global Ltd. London, UK, L&T (ECC) – both in Dubai & India, Delhi Underground Metro Corridor – MC1B and Fugro Geotech Ltd out of which he has served more than 6 years in Overseas prior to the academic career. During his tenure in Atkins Global Ltd in the UK as a Geotechnical Engineer, he has successfully delivered several foundation/geotechnical solutions as a lead designer for Crossrail London Rail Ltd, London Underground, Network Rail, UK, M50 Slope Widening Options, Ireland, raft foundation design for Sales Centre-Jumeirah Garden City Dubai for Meraas Development, Dubai. Presently he is actively involved in many challenging consultancy projects in Odisha as well as outside Odisha and executed projects with advanced technologies in Odisha state for National Highway, NBCC, ITDA etc. His major research focus is in the field of Geotechnical Engineering related to Pile Foundation, Ground Improvement and Soil structure interaction. He has published many research papers in International and national journals and also in conference proceedings. Details: Email: director.civil@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 56090254100. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: PhD in Geotechnical Engineering , IIT Bombay. Research Interests: Geotechnical Engineering. Memberships: Member of Institute of Civil Engineers, UK, 
British Geotechnical Society, UK
Fellow Member, Institution of Engineers & Indian Geotechnical Society, India.

Profile: Bitanjaya Das. Role: Sr. Professor. Bio: Prof. Bitanjaya Das is a Senior Professor in the School of Civil Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He joined KIIT-DU as Professor and Head of the Civil Engineering in 2004, and in the year 2012 promoted to Senior Professor. He has 36 years of teaching and research experience, and also served as the Head, and as the Dean of the School of the Civil Engineering. At the KIIT University level, worked as the Dean and subsequently as the Director of Students’ Affairs, Chief Warden of Hostels and Professor-in-Charge of the Central Library. Besides, officiated as the Registrar, Controller of Examinations and Dean of UG studies of KIIT-DU on several occasions. Details: Email: bdasfce@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Doctor of Engineering- Asian Institute of Technology (AIT), Bangkok, Thailand & University of Bonn, Germany.Master of Engineering- Asian Institute of Technology (AIT), Bangkok, Thailand; The Netherlands Government’s Full Fellowship.Bachelor of Engineering- OUAT, Bhubaneswar, India, National Scholarship, Govt. of India. Master of Engineering: - Asian Institute of Technology (AIT), Bangkok, Thailand; The Netherlands Government’s Full Fellowship.. Bachelor of Engineering: - OUAT, Bhubaneswar, India, National Scholarship, Govt. of India. Research Interests: Surface and Groundwater Hydrology, Free Surface Hydraulics, Irrigation Engineering & Management, WR Planning and Management, Application of Optimization techniques and GIS & RS in water sectors, Drought analysis & management. Projects: Improving Groundwater Levels and Quality through Enhanced Water Use Efficiency in Eastern Indian Agriculture. Profile: Brundaban Beriha. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Brundaban Beriha is presently working as an Assistant Professor at KIIT Deemed to be University, India. His broad area of research is pavement analysis and design. He has obtained his Ph.D. from IIT Bhubaneswar under the guidance of Dr. Umesh Chandra Sahoo. His Ph.D. works focuses on analysis and design of long life composite pavements. He has developed a computer program called “Cross Pave” which is capable of analyzing pavement considering the stress-dependent behavior of unbound granular materials. During his masters at IIT Kharagpur, he had worked under Dr. Sudeshna Mitra in the area of investigation of injury severity during collision. He has 14 publications to his name which includes publications in 08 reputed international journals and 06 conferences. Details: Email: brundaban.berihafce@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57212111556, Google Scholar: https:\/\/civil.kiit.ac.in//scholar.google.com/citations?user=hcm-AgYAAAAJ&hl=en. Profile: Dipti Ranjan Biswal. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Dipti Ranjan Biswal is working as an Associate professor in School of Civil Engineering, KIIT deemed to be university. Dr. Biswal was graduated from Indira Gandhi Institute of Technology (IGIT), Sarang under Biju Patnaik University of Technology in Civil Engineering. He earned MTech degree in Soil Mechanics and Foundation Engineering from National Institute of Technology Rourkela in 2006. After MTech, he joined MECON Ltd Ranchi and was involved in the structural design and detailed engineering of various civil engineering structures of integrated steel plant, power plant and also residential townships.  After four years of service in MECON, he moved to M N Dastur & Company Pvt Ltd as Senior Engineer and was involved in detailed engineering including planning, estimating and coordinating with different departments and clients. After 7 years of industrial experience he carried out research in IIT Bhubaneswar as a research scholar in the area of Transportation Geotechnics and completed PhD in 2018. He has published a number of research papers in international journals and conferences and is currently actively involved in teaching, research and consultancy works. Profile: Jyotiprakash Padhi. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Currently I am working as an Associate Professor in the School of Civil Engineering at KIIT DU, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. I obtained my Bachelor degree from Orissa University of Agriculture and Technology in 2002 and completed the Master degree in Soil and Water Conservation engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur in 2005. I got my PhD degree in 2010 from University of Southern Queensland, Australia and Post Doctorate from University of Nebraska, USA in 2015. Prior to my current position, I have also work experience in Indian Institute of Water Management, Bhubaneswar and University of Southern Queensland, Australia. I have all together more than 8 years of work experience in research and teaching. My research interests are water resource management, surface water hydrology and drought. I have  taught various courses, Water Resource Engineering, Fluid Mechanics, Surveying, Open Channel Hydraulics and Design of Water Resources Structures . I published 10 papers in International Journals, 8 papers in international conferences and 2 book chapters. I am also member of Professional societies, American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE), ASABE and Indian Science Congress. Coordinator of the two training program, Rain water harvesting and ground water recharge techniques in rural areas and Application of remote sensing and GIS in water resources engineering to the State Govt. Engineers organized by School of Civil Engineering in association with KRC, KIIT DU. Details: Email: jyotiprakash.padhifce@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Madhu Lisha Pattanaik. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr Madhu Lisha Pattanaik is currently working as a Assistant Professor in School of Civil Engineering, KIIT Deemed to be university, Bhubaneswar, India. She joined KIIT-DU in 2019 and has been involved in various teaching and research activity. She has obtained a PhD in Transportation Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Assam in the year 2019 on some studies on open graded friction course mixes with industrial waste. She has completed her Master Degree in Transportation Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, Assam in the year 2013 on some studies of warm mixes with Evotherm . She has completed her BE in Civil Engineering from Anna University in the year 2010. Her major research focus is in the field of Transportation Engineering related to Pavement Materials and Solid Waste Managements. She has Published many research papers in International journals and also presented in many national and international conferences. Profile: Manas Mishra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Manas is an assistant professor at the School of Civil Engineering at KIIT University. He works towards decreasing the gap between wastes and resources in India and abroad. His main focus is on increasing the utilisation of industrial wastes as acceptable alternatives to the virgin geomaterials. He has also worked in the area of problematic soils. He has done collaborative research with professors and scholars at University of Illinois (Chicago), IIT Bhubaneswar, IIT(ISM) Dhanbad, Shantou University (China), and IIT Gandhinagar. Mishra has completed his technical education (B.Tech, M.Tech. and Ph.D.) in civil engineering from Institutes of National Importance. His inclination towards teaching was influenced and strengthened during his M.Tech. at IIT Gandhinagar which boasts of a very versatile pedagogy as well as faculty. Mishra has a rich experience of handling various industrial and commercial projects in Bangalore and Chennai regions while working on site as a booking and planning engineer with consolidated construction consortium limited. He was working with KIIT University as an Assistant Professor after his masters at IIT Gandhinagar. During his tenure at KIIT, he was part of the core team to start a new program, "Construction Management and Infrastructure Development (CMID)", which was designed specifically to better equip B.Tech. graduate Civil Engineers to deal with the challenges of the construction industry. He joined KIIT University again in 2023 after having completed his Ph.D. from IIT Bhubaneswar in the same year. He is passionate about cycling, swimming, biking, diving, cliff jumping, and exploring. He flaunts formidable culinary skills acquired from various parts of the country. He is a voracious reader, dynamic anchor and a captivating public speaker. He thinks his biggest contribution as a faculty would be to ignite the feeling of nationalism and patriotism in his students as well as the pride in India's rich culture. Details: . Additional Info: Educational Qualification: B.Tech - Institutes of National ImportanceM.Tech - Institutes of National ImportancePh.D -  Institutes of National Importance

Profile: Mojahedul Islam Nayyer. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Mojahedul Islam Nayyer is an assistant professor at the School of Civil Engineering at KIIT University. Mr. Nayyer works to improve the management of infrastructure projects in India and abroad. He has global exposure in the planning and execution of mega projects. He has done collaborative research with professors at Harvard University, IIT Madras, and IIT Guwahati. His work on infrastructure projects was recognized as the best paper at the World Building Congress, held at RMIT University Australia in 2022.
Mr. Nayyer completed his B.Tech in Civil Engineering from BIT Sindri. Thereafter, he was involved in the construction of a 2000 MW thermal power plant project in Jharkhand. While implementing this project, Mr. Nayyer developed an interest in understanding the planning and execution of infrastructure projects in India. Hence, he joined the M.Tech - Infrastructure Engineering and Management program at the IIT Guwahati. After that, he joined KIIT Deemed to be University to teach B.Tech and M.Tech students. Since then, he has dedicated more than ten years to upskilling the youth entering the construction industry. He has guided more than ten M.Tech students in their dissertations. During his stay at KIIT, he started a new program, "Construction Management and Infrastructure Development (CMID)", designed specially to meet the challenges of the construction industry in the country. 
Moreover, Mr. Nayyer realized that corruption is a common phenomenon associated with infrastructure projects in many countries of the world. It hurts the performance of infrastructure projects and endangers accountability. Mr. Nayyer's unending curiosity motivated him to explore this aspect of infrastructure projects in an academic setting. He joined the PhD program at IIT Madras and focused his research on the impact of transparency and accountability on the performance of infrastructure projects. In his research, he analyzed the data from 997 completed highway projects implemented in India during the last 20 years. He found that the Indian Right to Information (RTI) Act 2005 significantly impacted the cost and schedule performance of highway projects. Projects implemented after the enactment of the RTI Act had lower time and cost overruns. His finding gives new hope that infrastructure projects can be completed efficiently in a transparent and accountable environment. Nayyer's research has been covered by Emerald, Springer, Edward Elgar, Earth and Environment Science, Swarajya, etc. He is a frequent writer and commentator on infrastructure projects. Details: Email: mojahedul.nayyerfce@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. - Indian Institute of Technology MadrasM.Tech. - Indian Institute of Technology GuwahatiB.Tech. – BIT Sindri Jharkhand. Profile: Nazia Tazin Imran. Role: Assistant professor. Bio: Nazia Tazin Imran is an assistant professor at the School of Civil Engineering- KIIT Deemed to be University. She obtained her B.Tech. in Civil Engineering from state government college Indira Gandhi Institute of Technology (IGIT) Sarang, Odisha. Thereafter, she pursued her M.Tech in Transportation Engineering at the National Institute of Technology (NIT), Warangal. During her stay in Warangal, her M.Tech dissertation was focused on the signal coordination of the major arterial network in the city. Thereafter, she went on to pursue a Ph.D. from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras. She is currently working on developing a bus signal priority system at a signalized intersection using vehicle-to-infrastructure (V2I) communication. The objective is to make transit services more appealing by reducing their schedule deviation and thus boosting their reliability to encourage more sustainable modes of transportation. Profile: Paromita Chakraborty. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Paromita Chakraborty is an Associate Professor in School of Civil Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. She joined KIIT-DU in 2012 and has been involved in various teaching and research activity. She earned her M.Tech in Hydraulics and Water Resource Enginnering from Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, and Ph.D. from Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar, Odisha. She is having 14 years of teaching and research experience besides 2 years of Industrial experience. Previously she has a worked in multinational company (Lons Lang Lasalle Megraj), and also worked in the educational institute ICFAI University Tripura. She has published many research articles in reputed international journals and conferences. Her Research domains are on the field of Flow Hydraulics in Open Channel, experimental analysis and modeling of Vegetated Flow, Multiphase Non-Newtonian Flow, Reservoir Sedimentation, and Rainfall-runoff modeling and hydrodynamic flow simulation. Profile: Prasanna Kumar Acharya. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Prasanna Kumar Acharya has been serving as an Associate Professor in the School of Civil Engineering at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, since January 2020. Before his academic tenure, he amassed over 30 years of extensive professional experience in the Public Works Department (PWD), Government of Odisha. During his distinguished career in PWD, he successfully led and executed numerous large-scale infrastructure projects, including highways, bridges, road over bridges (ROBs), and high-rise buildings. He also holds specialized expertise in the rehabilitation and retrofitting of civil engineering structures. Dr. Acharya’s research interests encompass sustainable construction materials, circular economy in construction, green concrete technology, geopolymer concrete, functionally graded concrete, and structural rehabilitation techniques. He has published several research papers in reputed international journals, contributing significantly to advancements in sustainable and innovative construction technologies. He is actively involved in various professional bodies and holds memberships and fellowships in prestigious organizations. He is a Life Member of the Indian Science Congress Association (ISCA), Indian Concrete Institute (ICI), Indian Roads Congress (IRC), and Indian Building Congress (IBC). Additionally, he is a Fellow (FIE) and Chartered Engineer of the Institution of Engineers (India). Details: Email: prasanna.acharyafce@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 56725221300. Additional Info:

Profile: Purnachandra Saha. Role: Professor. Bio: Dr. Purnachandra Saha is a Professor in School of Civil Engineering at KIIT DU, Bhubaneswar, India. He joined KIIT-DU in 2013 and has been involved in various teaching, and research activities. He received his PhD from IIT Bombay and teaching in Universities since 2009. He has worked in a multinational company (mainly design of industrial structure before completing his doctoral degree) for seven and half years. He has written more than 120 research articles (Journal & Conference Papers) among which 35 are with B. Tech students till date. He is Faculty Advisor of ASCE KIIT University Student Chapter. He Guided B. Tech students to won National Level Steel Design Competition organized by INSDAG, Ministry of Steel for 4 times (2016-17, 2019-20 and 2020-21, 2021-22). He is Member of ASCE, IE (I), EERI, ACI and Council of Vibration Specialists. Profile: Rakesh Ranjan Thakur. Role: Assistant Professor (II). Bio: Dr. Thakur has done his Ph.D. in Remote Sensing & Geoinformatics from Maharshi Dayanand Saraswati University, Ajmer, India, with more than 15 years of working experience in serving national and state-level scientific organizations. His research widely covers the fields of remote sensing, geospatial science, disaster management, natural resources management, mangrove and wetland studies, urban planning, water resources management, coastal vulnerability and applications, biodiversity studies, environmental studies, AI/ML-based applications in the geospatial domain, etc. With a strong research focus on harnessing geospatial technologies for sustainable development, he has made significant contributions to understanding and mitigating the impacts of natural disasters, managing natural resources, and monitoring environmental changes, informing policy and practice at local, national, and international levels. Details: Email: rakesh.thakurfce@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 58398139500, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=C54zKFsAAAAJ&view_op=list_works&authuser=1&gmla=AH8HC4wazJWDXiSL_3wnuY6i3Sk-SqqTT2QhbsK0uSA_8Wgh-XtqeCqurnCxqfulGpIjjQPjtWnjLblgQ-5uMRhD. Profile: Satyajeet Nanda. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Satyajeet Nanda is working as an Associate Professor in the School of Civil Engineering, KIIT deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He obtained Ph.D. in 2013 from the Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur. He completed his M.Tech from IIT BHU and B.Tech. from CET, OUAT Bhubaneswar. He has worked as postdoctoral research fellow in School of Natural and Built Environment, Queen’s University Belfast, United Kingdom between Dec. 2013 and Dec. 2016. 
Since the last eight years, Dr. Satyajeet Nanda is working on offshore Geotechnical engineering. He has been successfully completed a number of research assignment on various subjects related to offshore Geotechnical engineering. His research includes; load-settlement behavior of long piles, behavior of monopile in offshore loading condition, crushing properties of offshore sand, deep water anchor system and strain rate effect of soft soil using T-bar. Profile: Sunny Jaiswal. Role: Assistant professor. Bio: Areas of Interest: Offshore structural engineering Engineering, response control of jacket structure using MR damper, High-rise buildings and Concrete as a construction material.
Mr. Sunny Jaiswal has done his Btech. in Civil Engineering from JUET, Guna and M.Tech in Offshore Structural engineering from Indian Institute of Technology, Chennai. His master's research was on “Response control of jacket structure using MR damper”.He joined KIIT Deemed to be university  in June 2017 as Assistant professor (Grade-I) in school of civil engineering.Currently he is working on Geopolymer- concrete and self compacting concrete. Profile: Prof Sanjib Moulick. Role: Professor/Dean. Bio: Dr. Sanjib Moulick received his Ph.D. from IIT Kharagpur in 2002. He subsequently worked as a Research Associate at IIT Kharagpur from 2002 to 2003, and then took on the role of Design Engineer for the Kerala Water Supply Project in Thiruvananthapuram. He served as a faculty at SASTRA University, Thanjavur from 2004 to 2007, and at IIT Kharagpur from 2007 to 2011. Since 2012, he has been with KIIT University, starting as an Associate Professor (II) and advancing to the rank of Professor in 2016. He served as Associate Dean of the School of Civil Engineering from July 2017 to October 2020, before becoming the Dean from October 2020 to June 2024. He currently holds the position of Dean at KIIT eXtension School, overseeing the university's online programs.
During his tenure as Dean, the School of Civil Engineering achieved successful accreditation by both ABET, USA, and the NBA. He played a key role in establishing a partnership with L&T EduTech to introduce industry-focused specialization courses for B.Tech students, offering opportunities for industrial immersion, placement support, and internships. Additionally, he helped launch a Graduate Talent Development Program in Building Information Modeling (BIM) in collaboration with InteliBIM, aimed at final-year B.Tech students to equip them with vital skills for careers in construction technology and BIM. In partnership with UltraTech, Campus to Corporate program was launched for the final year BTech students, aiming to prepare them for corporate roles by combining academic coursework with internships. These collaborations with industry leaders provided students with exceptional access to real-world expertise, advanced technology, and a curriculum aligned with industry needs, ushering in a new era of growth and opportunity.
Dr. Moulick specializes in Environmental Engineering, with a focus on water and wastewater treatment, water reuse system design, and water quality management. He has guided seven Ph.D. scholars and eleven M.Tech students. His research has led to the publication of 35 Scopus-indexed peer-reviewed journal and conference papers, along with two patents. He has been involved in six sponsored research projects, funded by agencies such as SERB, DST, MOES, NABARD, ISIRD, as well as an industry-funded project on the "Performance Evaluation of Basuaghai Faecal Sludge Treatment Plant," conducted by Ernst & Young LLP under the "Swachha Odisha Sustha Odisha" initiative.
Over his 20-year academic career, Dr. Moulick has taught a variety of BTech and MTech courses, including Engineering Mechanics, Solid Mechanics, Engineering Drawing, Environmental Studies, Environmental Science, Structural Analysis, Environmental Engineering I & II, Transport of Water and Wastewater, Solid and Hazardous Waste Management, and Water Quality Modelling and Management. Details: Email: smoulickfce@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. from IIT Kharagpur in 2002. Research Interests: Environmental Engineering
